intro: Paralabatia estoriensis, commonly known as the Estori's paralabatia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Estori in the southern Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pentamerous flowers with five petals. The plant has small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near streams or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
